abstract: Appaloosa Management and Carl C. Icahn are among four bidders that may make offers Thursday for Delphi, the bankrupt auto-parts maker, The New York Post reported.
snippet: Appaloosa Management and Carl C. Icahn are among four bidders that may make offers Thursday for Delphi, the bankrupt auto-parts maker, The New York Post reported.
lead_paragraph: Appaloosa Management may still have feelings for Delphi, the bankrupt auto-parts maker that found itself scrambling for alternatives after the hedge fund dropped out of the plan to fund Delphi’s exit from Chapter 11 in 2008.

headline.main: Appaloosa and Icahn Are Said to Consider Bids for Delphi
